posts.post_content:
Offered here is a Very Nice B18 Blanket of Kelly HOGF. His name is spelled incorrectly as Kelley. I originally thought it was Joe Kelley but another board member advised the player is Billy Kelly. (name still spelled wrong) . A second board member confirmed it is Joe Kelly the HOF noting the first base mans glove . Thanks to the board members for contributing. I always thought it was Joe Kelly as I have been collecting and trading this issue for many years. This is the purple pennant variation. This blanket has bright pennants with clear printing and excellent registration. It has 4 brown border. The back has a hint of factory overspray or wet sheet transfer. 
$40.00. SOLD

[quote name="ricktmd" post=2092536]Offered here is a Very Nice B18 Blanket of Joe Kelly HOF. His name is spelled incorrectly as Kelley. This is the purple pennant variation. This blanket has bright pennants with clear printing and excellent registration. It has 4 brown border. The back has a hint of factory overspray or wet sheet transfer. 
$55.00[/QUOTE]

This is not HOFer Joseph J. Kelley. It's Pirates outfielder Joseph H. Kelly. Still a tough blanket, though.

The B18 actually shows HOFer Joe Kelley. (Note the first baseman's glove.)

Joe Kelly,  the first year outfielder was on the 1914 Pirates, and that's where the confusion occurred!

[url]https://www.net54baseball.com/showthread.php?t=300319[/url]

Patrick
